lead_paragraph: In the more powerful of the Monday attacks, a truck of explosives was rammed into the wall of a compound for foreign and Afghan civilian contractors, killing one and injuring more than 20.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar reported from Kabul, and Mujib Mashal from Colombo, Sri Lanka.
byline.original: By JAWAD SUKHANYAR and MUJIB MASHAL

headline.print_headline: Kabul Airport Bombings Add to String of Attacks
headline.main: Bombings Near Kabul Airport Add to String of Attacks Around Afghan Capital

snippet: In the more powerful of the Monday attacks, a truck of explosives was rammed into the wall of a compound for foreign and Afghan civilian contractors, killing one and injuring more than 20.
abstract: Two separate attacks near Kabul's international airport kill one person and wound 22; Taliban claims responsibility for second, deadly attack, amid speculation militant group seeks leverage ahead of peace talks with officials from Afghanistan, Pakistan, China and United States.
